case_vignette: A mother brings her 3-year-old son to the doctor because she is worried that he might be harming himself by constantly banging his head on the wall. He has been exhibiting this behavior for a few months. She is also worried because he has started to speak less than he used to and does not respond when his name is called. He seems aloof during playtime with other children and seems to have lost interest in most of his toys.
question: What is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Pediatrics and Neonatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been banging my head on the wall a lot, I'm not talking as much as I used to, I don't answer when someone calls my name, and I don't really want to play with other kids or with most of my toys.
Have you had any recent changes in your appetite or sleep patterns?
My appetite and sleep haven't changed; they seem to be the same as before.
Have you had any recent injuries or accidents?
No, I haven't had any injuries or accidents recently.
Have you had any recent changes in your medication or any new medications added to your routine?
No, I haven't had any changes or new medications.
Have you had any recent changes in your family's medical history?
No, there haven't been any changes in my family's medical history recently.
Final Diagnosis: Autism Spectrum Disorder.

trial_0.summarized_conversation: A child has been showing signs of regression, such as banging their head on the wall, decreased speech, unresponsiveness to their name being called, and decreased interest in playing with other kids or toys. The child's appetite and sleep patterns have remained consistent. There have been no recent injuries or accidents, no changes in medication, and no recent changes in the family's medical history.
trial_0.vignette_mcq: The most likely diagnosis is Autism spectrum disorder.
trial_0.vignette_frq: The most likely diagnosis is Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD).
trial_0.summarized_mcq: The most likely diagnosis is Autism spectrum disorder.
trial_0.summarized_frq: The most likely diagnosis is Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD).
